meanings.definition: The possibility of finding new sources of valuable biological resources.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are excited about the bioprospects in the unexplored rainforest.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the ocean depths may lead to exciting bioprospects for medicine.
meanings.sent3: The bioprospects of the hidden cave turned out to be just rocks and dirt.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, the mirage offered false bioprospects of an oasis.
meanings.sent5: The bioprospects of the ancient ruins captured the archaeologists' attention.

meanings.definition: To search for potential biological resources for commercial or scientific purposes.
meanings.sent1: Researchers bioprospect the rainforest for new plant species with medicinal properties.
meanings.sent2: Companies often bioprospect the ocean floor for unique organisms with commercial value.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that he would bioprospect his backyard for new insect species.
meanings.sent4: Explorers bioprospected the mountain caves for rare minerals and crystals.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to bioprospect the jungle for undiscovered animal species.
